_description: The Abuses of the Age — fourteen lines roughly rhyming in some pairs (couplets)

OxfJesus29.First Lines:
Hwan þu sixst vnleodeking þat is wilfulAnd Domes mon
                    ny myndepreost þat is wilde…
OxfJesus29.Last Lines:
…Lond wiþ vten laweAl so seyde BedeWo þere
                    þeode
OxfJesus29.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             An Old English Miscellany: A Bestiary, Kentish Sermons, Proverbs of
                Alfred and Religious Poems of the Thirteenth Century.
EETS
         o.s. 49 (1872); repr. 1988: 184.

BLCottCalAIX.First Lines: Hƿan þu sixst on leoðKing þat is ƿilful…
BLCottCalAIX.Last Lines: …Lond ƿið oute laȝeAlso seide bedeWo þere þeode
